poem:
"Exit-Cue"

A morning star hesitates,  
steps into another light, Bear Hunt sings.
14 years- ripe fruits relinquished  
for a rosier dawn beyond TV's clasp.

Murmurs of sinister whispers  
rattle, craft the November's chill.  
TV is a turbulent sea,
Sacrifice, frills of convention. 

Life, a longer show,
fleeing past the limelight's reach.  
Her shadow is her own again.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Holly Willoughby to make Netflix show in first major move since This Morning Holly Willoughby has made her first major move since leaving This Morning, signing up to host a new Netflix show, Bear Hunt with Bear Grylls. In October she announced she was quitting the ITV show after 14 years “for me and my family” after it emerged she was the target of an alleged kidnap and murder plot. It followed a turbulent time". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
